In Shell Scripting, determine the output of the following bash code:

hack.sh

n=22
s=0
x=""
on=$n
while [ $n -gt 0 ]
do
                s=$(( $n % 10 )) 
                n=$(( $n / 10 ))  
                x=$( echo ${x}${s} ) 
done
if [ $on -eq $x ];
then
        echo "Hello HackerEarth!"
else
        echo "Welcome to HakerEarth!"
fi

Note: Assume that you have provided executable permissions to this file and executed the file using the following two commands:

$chmod +x hack.sh
$./hack.sh

Bob is preparing for the interviews of shell scripting. There are certain conditions that he has to go through if the input is 1 that means he has cleared round 1 and if the input is 2 that means he is selected otherwise he will have to try once again.

Now, the following options represent different programs and you are required to select the most appropriate one for the desired output given.

Desired outputs

(i) Congratulations, You are selected  (or)

(ii) Congratulations, You have cleared Round 1(or)

(iii) You can give it one more try!

Options

1.

#!/bin/bash
echo "Type your coupon number"
read n
if [ "$n" -eq 2 ];
then
echo "Congratulations, You are selected"
else if [ "$n" -eq 1 ];
then
echo "Congratulations,You have cleared Round 1"
else
echo "You can give it one more try!"
fi
fi

2.

#!/bin/bash
echo "Type your coupun number"
read n
if [ "$n" -eq 2 ];
then
echo "Congratulations, You are selected"
else if [ "$n" -eq 1 ];
then
echo "Congratulations,You have cleared Round 1"
else
echo "You can give it one more try!"
fi

3.

#!/bin/bash
echo "Type your coupon number"
read n
if [ "$n" -eq 2 ];
then
echo "Congratulations, You have cleared Round 1"
else if [ "$n" -eq 1 ];
then
echo "Congratulations, You are selected" 
else
echo "You can give it one more try!"
fi
fi

4.

#!/bin/bash
echo "Type your coupon number"
read n
if [ "$n" -eq 2 ];
then
echo "You can give it one more try !"
else if [ "$n" -eq 1 ];
then
echo "Congratulations, You are selected" 
else
echo "Congratulations, You have cleared Round 1"
fi
fi
